summary: What's wrong with Shazam being a purely fantasy book?
question: What's wrong with Shazam being a purely fantasy book?
answer:
For me, one of the biggest appeals of the original Captain Marvel comics is that it embodies the most variable, outlandish side of comics. You can have a tiger who taught himself to wear a business suit, an ancient wizard, a Nazi super soldier, or a genocidal alien caterpillar, all in the same title. It’s ridiculous and over the top and FUN. Johns is taking away a lot of that craziness, and I think it’s a shame.

Sivana in particular is a sticking point for me because he is pretty much THE archetypical mad scientist that all others are based on. If a mad scientist drops doesn’t come from Victor Frankenstein, it probably comes from Sivana. Making him an evil sorcerer is like if Peter Jackson made Gandalf into a gun-toting alien cyborg. It feels like a betrayal of the character’s iconic roots.

title: Interview
body: Hello, I am a data journalism student. I am writing a piece on the evolution of female superhero/comic book characters over time. I would like to interview anyone who has an opinion, or a personal connection to female comic book characters. Message me if interested or have any questions!

summary: MS. MARVEL EPIC COLLECTION:THE WOMAN WHO FELL TO EARTH TPB Volume #2 in the Ms. Marvel Epic Collections Written by CHRIS...
caption:
MS. MARVEL EPIC COLLECTION:THE WOMAN WHO FELL TO EARTH TPB

Volume #2 in the Ms. Marvel Epic Collections
Written by CHRIS CLAREMONT with JIM SHOOTER, DAVID MICHELINIE, GEORGE PEREZ, BOB LAYTON, PETER B. GILLIS & SIMON FURMAN
Penciled by JIM MOONEY & MIKE VOSBURG with DAVE COCKRUM, GEORGE PEREZ, FRANK MILLER, MICHAEL GOLDEN, CARMINE INFANTINO, HOWARD CHAYKIN, JEFF ACLIN, JUAN ORTIZ & MIKE GUSTOVICH
Cover by DAVE COCKRUM
ON SALE MAY 2019
Chris Claremont weaves complex plots and compelling characterization in the conclusion of Carol Danvers’ original adventures! As Ms. Marvel, Carol meets the Avengers for the first time! The shape-shifting Mystique makes her debut! A battle with Ronan the Accuser brings Carol and Mar-Vell together — and leads to a new look for our heroine! Encounters with Deathbird, the Guardians of the Galaxy and Sabretooth set the stage for a controversial Avengers saga and a life-altering battle against Mystique and Rogue, culminating in a major Marvel milestone featuring the X-Men and Avengers! Plus: Carol battles the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants — and mourns the passing of Mar-Vell! Collecting MS. MARVEL (1977) #15-23, MARVEL TEAM-UP (1972) #76-77, MARVEL TWO-IN-ONE (1974) #51, AVENGERS (1963) #200 and ANNUAL #10; and material from MARVEL SUPER-HEROES (1990) #10-11, AVENGERS (1963) #197-199 and MARVEL FANFARE (1982) #24.
376 PGS./Rated T …$34.99
ISBN: 978-1-302-91802-6

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

summary: Captain Marvel and Spider-Gwen, how's your day?
question: Captain Marvel and Spider-Gwen, how's your day?
answer:
”That stupid, Bratty Samus and Toga left me tied up again after one of their stupid fetish sessions, and now I’ve missed breakfast!” Gwen Stacy complained.

Spider-Gwen let loose a volley of thwips, long strands of web connecting to walls and countertops in various places on in the kitchen. A loud scraping sound filled the dining room as Gwen tried to pull her chubby body toward the fridge. Her belly and boobs sloshing and rocking like she was made of jello.

“Do you need some help dear?” Captain marvel asked with a rougish grin. “Or should I just wait for you to topple that chair yourself?”

Puffing and out of breath, Gwen Stacy paused, her mask pulled up past her nose gave Earth’s Mightiest hero a perfect view of the nasty food stained scowl thrown at her. 

"Don’t you have some skrulls to stop?”

"I’ve got these scones to stop.” Carol said taking one from the plate and shoving it halfway into Gwen’s mouth before walking out the door with the rest.

Gwen screamed into the pastry in frustration, and the loud scraping of the chair continued.

blog.name: awardscircuit

tags: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
summary: New Post has been published on http://bit.ly/2Wztmb3 Circuit Q&A - What Will Be the Biggest Hit of 2019?   **Circuit Q&A’s are...
caption:
New Post has been published on http://bit.ly/2Wztmb3

Circuit Q&A - What Will Be the Biggest Hit of 2019?

**Circuit Q&A’s are our daily community question, posed to the readers of AwardsCircuit that cover various topics from film and television to general wonderings and for instances**

As we fully get into the 2019 movie calendar, we’re turning out attention away from the biggest in 2018 cinema. Now, it’s time to start thinking more and more about this year’s releases. For today’s question, we’re interested in knowing what your predictions are for these upcoming works. In particular, is there one that you think will end up being the most talked about of the year?

On the one hand, it could end up being one of the potential Academy Award hopefuls this next time around. The two that immediately jump out are Martin Scorsese‘s “The Irishman” and Quentin Tarantino‘s “Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.” The former will see Netflix release their biggest title to date. Imagine the acclaim of “Roma” with an even more commercially viable product. As for the latter, it’s Tarantino working with one of his starriest casts ever. Everything he does is an event, so this will be no exception. Perhaps you’re predicting it to finally get QT a Best Picture or Best Director statue? That would make it one of the most talked about 2019 releases for sure.

On the other hand, maybe it’s just going to be a blockbuster? If so, the obvious choices are “Avengers: Endgame” and “Captain Marvel.” These superhero titles represent both a beginning and an end for the Marvel Cinematic Universe, so that could make them cultural events. Besides, when in doubt, defer to the MCU.

We put the question to you now. What are your predictions for 2019 movies? Which will end up being the one we talk most about? Let us know!

Which 2019 Release Do You Think Will End Up Being The Most Talked About?

Share all your thoughts in the comments below!

reblog.comment:
New Post has been published on http://bit.ly/2Wztmb3

Circuit Q&A - What Will Be the Biggest Hit of 2019?

External image

**Circuit Q&A’s are our daily community question, posed to the readers of AwardsCircuit that cover various topics from film and television to general wonderings and for instances**

As we fully get into the 2019 movie calendar, we’re turning out attention away from the biggest in 2018 cinema. Now, it’s time to start thinking more and more about this year’s releases. For today’s question, we’re interested in knowing what your predictions are for these upcoming works. In particular, is there one that you think will end up being the most talked about of the year?

On the one hand, it could end up being one of the potential Academy Award hopefuls this next time around. The two that immediately jump out are Martin Scorsese‘s “The Irishman” and Quentin Tarantino‘s “Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.” The former will see Netflix release their biggest title to date. Imagine the acclaim of “Roma” with an even more commercially viable product. As for the latter, it’s Tarantino working with one of his starriest casts ever. Everything he does is an event, so this will be no exception. Perhaps you’re predicting it to finally get QT a Best Picture or Best Director statue? That would make it one of the most talked about 2019 releases for sure.

External image

On the other hand, maybe it’s just going to be a blockbuster? If so, the obvious choices are “Avengers: Endgame” and “Captain Marvel.” These superhero titles represent both a beginning and an end for the Marvel Cinematic Universe, so that could make them cultural events. Besides, when in doubt, defer to the MCU.

We put the question to you now. What are your predictions for 2019 movies? Which will end up being the one we talk most about? Let us know!

Which 2019 Release Do You Think Will End Up Being The Most Talked About?

Share all your thoughts in the comments below!

External image

summary: Apparently one of the Hungarian publishing houses which deals in comics publication is preparing a book in the honor of the...
body: Apparently one of the Hungarian publishing houses which deals in comics publication is preparing a book in the honor of the Captain Marvel movie coming out, and I’m having my fingers crossed that they’re publishing something post-2012, or I’m really, really gonna facepalm.
